title: MStore Hosted Web Servers
text: We have 3 e-commerce servers. 2 x Node 4 (BUY & BUY2) and 1 with Fasthost (SHOP). We also have a SQL multi-tenant server mstorecloud.k3btg.com hosted by Node4 which is for hosting epos databases and nothing to do with e-commerce plus a non-customer facing server for all MStore staff to use for whatever they need is hosted with Node4. All staff have access via TeamViewer. See 0d. Hosted Companies for which customers have what hosted by us
description:
We have 3 e-commerce servers. 2 x Node 4 (BUY & BUY2) and 1 with Fasthost (SHOP).


We also have a SQL multi-tenant server mstorecloud.k3btg.com hosted by Node4 which is for hosting epos databases and nothing to do with e-commerce plus a non-customer facing server for all MStore staff to use for whatever they need is hosted with Node4. All staff have access via TeamViewer. 


See 0d. Hosted Companies for which customers have what hosted by us

title: MStore Hosted SQL Databases
text: Our MStore Cloud server (mstorecloud.k3btg.com - 185.113.18.51) hosts multiple of our customers on different SQL instances, segregated by their corresponding port, as stated below. See 0d. Hosted Companies for which customers have what hosted by us If you require the server string for any of the customer sites, you will be able to retrieve this from LastPass, which will include the customers personal hash details to access only their database. Customer databases are mstorecloud.k3btg.com,14337 mstorecloud.k3btg.com,14338 mstorecloud.k3btg.com,14339 mstorecloud.k3btg.com,14335 We also have mstorecloud.k3btg.com,14331 - Internal use only (only use these databases if instructed to do so) Training A Training B Training Internal (For Support Use) - This database has a test website set up against it for testing. If you need to update the version please ask Rich or Harry before doing so! Web Development Test Environment VictorUAT
description:
Our MStore Cloud server (mstorecloud.k3btg.com - 185.113.18.51) hosts multiple of our customers on different SQL instances, segregated by their corresponding port, as stated below.


See 0d. Hosted Companies for which customers have what hosted by us


If you require the server string for any of the customer sites, you will be able to retrieve this from LastPass, which will include the customers personal hash details to access only their database.


Customer databases are

  • mstorecloud.k3btg.com,14337
  • mstorecloud.k3btg.com,14338
  • mstorecloud.k3btg.com,14339
  • mstorecloud.k3btg.com,14335


We also have mstorecloud.k3btg.com,14331 - Internal use only (only use these databases if instructed to do so)

  • Training A
  • Training B
  • Training Internal (For Support Use) - This database has a test website set up against it for testing. If you need to update the version please ask Rich or Harry before doing so!
  • Web Development Test Environment
  • VictorUAT

title: Webserver IP's for whitelisting
text: If a customer's IT team asks for the webserver IP address which they need to whitelist, please send the relevant one over from the below Server Name External IP Address BUY (Existing. Will be replaced soon) 185.10.91.88 BUY NEW 109.228.56.35 BUY2 185.113.18.51 BUY2 NEW 109.228.58.205 SHOP 109.228.28.169 SHOP2 109.228.46.91

title: Unable to modify voucher codes - Website config
text: If you are unable to access to Discount Vouchers and the below error shows: This is normally caused by the fact their IP has not been whitelisted or their IP address has changed. The new public IP address that is in use will need to be entered into the white listed IP config field. Once we have this information we can log into their website and access the web config: (Under booking templates if you aren't sure) If it doesn't exist you will have to get support to add this field : WhiteListedIPs If it does exist, simply add the IP address and click 'Update' to save the change. (You can add multiple IP's between commas)
description:
If you are unable to access to Discount Vouchers and the below error shows: 

  

 

  

This is normally caused by the fact their IP has not been whitelisted or their IP address has changed. The new public IP address that is in use will need to be entered into the white listed IP config field. 

  

Once we have this information we can log into their website and access the web config: 

(Under booking templates if you aren't sure) 

  

 

  

  

 

  

If it doesn't exist you will have to get support to add this field : WhiteListedIPs 

  

If it does exist, simply add the IP address and click 'Update' to save the change.  

  

 

(You can add multiple IP's between commas)

title: Website Config Options
text: https://axk3btg.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/K3ExeterDev/Shared%20Documents/General/Website%20Config%20Options.docx?d=we33ab0bc65ee415e9cc548520eee294d&csf=1&web=1&e=fdV4cK Website Config Options These are used to send booking & order confirmation emails. • EMAILFROMADD • EMAILSERVER • EMAILSERVERUID • EMAILSERVERPWD • EMAILSERVERPORT • EMAILSERVERSSL • EMAILSERVERTIMEOUT SECOPTSTR - This is to set the payment gateway to LIVE or TEST mode Values: ‘TEST’, ‘LIVE’, or for PayPoint (SecPay): Test Positive = test_status=true,dups=false,repeat=true Test Negative = test_status=false,dups=false,repeat=true Live = test_status=live,repeat=true Address lookups. • CAPSCANUID • CAPSCANPWD CUSTSERVEMAIL – Email address used for shop questions. CUSTSERVTEL – Phone number used for shop help COMPANYNAME – Name of website. DEFAULTTEMPLATE – Goes to this if no TID is specified. EMAILCCBKGCONF. 0 – Don’t send CC booking email, 1 send it. EMAILCCBKGCONFTOADDR – CC booking email address. EMAILBCCBKGCONF. 0 – Don’t send BCC booking email, 1 send it. EMAILBCCBKGCONFTOADDR – BCC booking email address. EMAILREPLYTOADDR – “Reply To” address used if customer replies to booking confirmation emails. PAYMENTPROVIDER – Payment Provider name, e.g. PayPoint, SagePayDirect, WorldPay etc. PAYPALEMAILADDRESS – PayPal email address used for PayPal integration. These are specific options for PayPal integration: • PAYPALRETURNURL • PAYPALCANCELURL COMPANYHOMEPAGE – URL of “Back to Home” link used on the confirmation page. COMPANYTERMSPAGE – T’s & C’s URL to link to from the payment page. REGISTRATION – Values are ‘none’, ’optional’ or ‘required’ USEVOUCHERS – Show the voucher box on the basket page. These are specific options the party page: • PARTYFOOD – Comma separated template ID’s that require party food options. • PARTYMEMBERNOS – Comma separated template ID’s that require party membership numbers. • LIMITPARTYDROPDOWNS – Set max quantity for party dropdowns. • PARTYNOTICEPERIOD – Number of days from today’s date before party is available UNAVAILABILITYCOLOURS - Format: , [] AVAILABILITYCOLOURS – Format: , [] SELECTEDCOLOURS – Format: , [] HIDEUNSELECTEDMONTH – On Buy, BuyAvail & Sessions pages, only show currently selected month days on calendar. GIFTAIDEXTRA – Paragraph appears under GA coins GIFTAIDDEFAULTOFF – GA is unselected unless items in basket and GA has been chosen already. GIFTAIDBLURBABOVE – Put GA section above the ticket section. Buy/Sessions/Memberships only (ATM). VIRTUALFOLDER – Used by SagePay to return to website folder. APPLY3DSECURE – Allow for 3D Secure for card details after payment details submitted. BACKOFFICEPASSWORD – Password used by customer to access website back-office for updates and other website admin functions. EMAILTEMPLATE – Name of template file used for booking emails (depreciated, only used by WH). CONTINUESHOPPING – URL to go to when the “Continue Shopping” button is clicked. SHOPCHECKSTOCK – Allows sales of shop items to be limited by stock levels. SHOPSTOCKRINGFENCE – Quantity to remove from stock level to further limit sales. DELIVERYOPTIONS – Values 0 or 1. Show delivery area (UK, EU, ROW) + shipping prices in basket. A value of “2” - Allows different postage option based on what is in the basket. Postage services & bands need to be setup in advance. DELIVERYMETHOD – Calculate shipping price by “weight” (per area “UK/EU/ROW”) or “price” or “weight only”. SITETAGLINE – Paragraph shown on the shop category page COMPLETEORDERS – Allow the “complete orders” page to be accessed from the website back-office. UPDATETRANSLATIONS – Allow additional language translations to be accessed from the website back-office. UPDATEEMAILTEMPLATES –Allow confirmation email templates to be updated from the website back-office. ALLOWDIFFSESSIONDATE – Allow the session date to be different on follow-on templates. AUTOCONTINUENODATA – If disallowing different dates, auto continue if selected date is not available when following on to next template. SHOWTOTALAVAILABLE – Show session total next to each time-slot. On by default. SESSIONAVAILABILTYMAX – If available quantity is over this value, show “available” instead of quantity. EMAILGIFTAIDTHANKS – Paragraph to add to the booking confirmation email if the tag in in the template and the booking has been Gift Aided. SESSIONNOTICEPERIOD – Number of days from today’s date before sessions are available. SESSIONNOTICEPERIODHOURS – Number of days from current time before session time-slots are available. MEMBEREMAIL – Email address to send to for copies of purchased memberships. ADOPTIONEMAIL – Email address to send to for copies of purchased adoptions. RETAILEMAIL – Email address to send to for copies of purchased adoptions. TIMESLOTSESSIONDESC – 0/1 Show session description on session time-slot BOOKINGSOURCE – 0/1 Store selected booking source for booking. BOOKINGSOURCEREQUIRED – Set the booking source on payment page to be mandatory. SAMEDAYCUTOFFTIME- Time after which no further bookings can be placed for today. TELEPHONEREQUIRED – Set telephone to be mandatory on the payment page. COUNTYREQUIRED – Set county to be mandatory on the payment page. DEBUGLOG – Log additional details about the booking process. DISABLEGIFTAIDPOPUP – Buy/Memberships/Renewal skips past the GA popup. AllOWGIFTING – Values ‘address’,’name & email’, ‘addressoptional’. Allow booking to be gifted to a different address or name & email. Shows different messages on the confirmation page. FIXEDVALIDITYPERIODS – 0/1 Used by RHS on Buy page for Jan – Mar, Apr – Oct buying periods. These are setup in table “TemplatePeriod”. USEMEMBERSHIPS – Allows membership pages to be used on the website. USEDONATIONS – Shows a checkbox to add donation (the gift aid price) regardless of whether the booking is Gift Aided DONATEBYDEFAULT – If using the donations tick-box, tick it by default. SHOWONEGAPRICE – 1 or 0. This will show one price in the grid that changes based on whether the booking is Gift Aided. ADOPTIONSHOWEMAIL – Email address textbox is displayed on the membership details screen. ADOPTIONSHOWPHONE – Telephone textbox is displayed on the membership details screen. ADOPTIONSHOWADDRESS – Address textboxes are displayed on the membership details screen. ADOPTIONSHOWDOB – Date of birth textboxes are displayed on the membership details screen. ADOPTIONDONATIONS – Allow donations to be added for adoptions. “1” By Default FORCEDATEPICK – Hides the sales grid until a booking date is selected. WEBSERVICEURL – The URL for the webservice installed on the customer’s server. WEBSERVICEUSERNAME – The login name for the webservice. WEBSERVICEPASSWORD – The password for the webservice. MEMBERTERMS – The URL to membership T’s & C’s. Will display a tick box on the membership webpage that requires ticking. PRODUCTSPERPAGE – The number of products to show per page. Default is 4. VATNUMBER – The business VAT number. VATPERCENTAGE – The current VAT percentage. Default is 20. EMAILEMBEDDED – Default is 0. Email barcodes & logos are sent in the email content instead as references to images. PROMOEMAILS – Default is 1. Shows the “Do you want to receive promotional emails” check box on payment page. DONATIONRESOURCE – The resource ID of the donation resource record. DONATIONROUNDUP – Default is 0. Will show on the basket page an option to round up to the nearest £10. So if the basket total is £17, this option will round the price to £20 with a £3 donation. HASRETAIL - Default is 0. Allow the shop items to be displayed. MEMBERTEMPNO - Default is 1. Will show the temporary membership number on the confirmation email. ALLOWDELIVERYADDRESS - Default is 0. This will display a checkbox on the payment page that allows a delivery address to be entered. ALLOWGIFTING option must be blank ADMINORDEREMAIL - Email address to send copy of order confirmation email to. Admin order email is sent to this address. ADMINADOPTIONEMAIL – Email address to send admin adoption email to. ADMINMEMBEREMAIL – Email address to send admin membership email to. ADMINSALESORDEREMAIL – Email address to send sales order email to. ADMINRETAILEMAIL – Email address to send order email to. SECONDDBRESIDS – Second database list of resource IDs. (Used by Paignton Zoo to record booking at Living Coasts) SECONDDBURL –Second database web service URL. USEDONATIONCHOICE- Show a Yes/No donation option on buy pages. PARTYARRIVALHOUR – Default is 9. Shown on party webpage. If set to -1, arrival time is hidden from the party page and arrival defaulted to 9am. LISTTEMPLATEIDS – The templates shown on the welcome page. Can be "ALL" or comma separated list of IDs. ADOPTIONFOLLOWONID – The template to show after an adoption has been selected. SUPPRESSPAYERSELECTOR – 1 or 0. Hide member payer dropdown box. GADONATIONCOMBO – 1 or 0. Show “Donation” checkbox for Gift Aid. WEBREPORTS – 1 or 0. Display website reports button in the admin section. SHOWSESSIONTITLE – 1 or 0. Show session page template name as the page title. SESSIONAUTOSCROLL – 1 or 0. 1 by default. Set the session page to automatically scroll when selecting a time slot. SESSIONHIDEENDTIME – 1 or 0. Only show start time. CONFIRMATIONBASKET – 1 or 0. Display the basket on the confirmation page after a successful payment. DONATIONDELETEONLY- 1 or 0. Does not show donation section if donation has been made. WELCOMESEASONTID – Set welcome button to go to a specific template ID. RENEWALSAMESCHEME – 1 or 0. Disable all schemes except membership scheme currently enrolled on. CHECKACCESSLOOKUP – 1 or 0. Allow check access lookup in admin section CHECKACCESSPASSWORD – Password for access to admin section for check access page. GOOGLEANALYTICSACCCODE – GA account code for confirmation page tracking. USEALTGAID – If webpage parameter “AltGA=true” is present, this alternative Google Analytics code is used instead. “” needs to also be present in the GA script on the MainPage.master webpage. SKIPBASKETPAGE – 1 or 0. After buy page, redirect to login or payment page. MEMBERSHOWBASKETPAGE – 1 or 0. Redirect to the basket page after membership details have been entered. FOLLOWONREDIRECT – 1 or 0. Redirect to starting template no items are in the basket and the template is part of the chain. SHOWINHOUSEPRICE – 1 or 0. Show gate or in-house price on the ticket grid. HIDETITLEOFNAME – 1 or 0. Hide title dropdown on payment page. DISALLOWDIFFERENTDATES – 1 or 0. Show message on session page if a different date is selected for something already in the basket. ENFORCESTARTTEMPLATE – 1 or 0. Checks if item in basket and if not, do not add items to be added to basket. LIMITQTYTOSTARTTEMPLATE – 1 or 0. Follow-on template items have a maximum quantity is what was selected on start template. MEMBERSHIPSTARTDATE – 1 or 0. Show membership start date on initial membership page. MEMBERSHIPHIDEDETAILS – 1 or 0. V1 membership, hide membership detail validation. MEMBERDETAILSV2 – 1 or 0. Use version 2 (hobbledown style) for membership entry. MEMBERSHIPSTARTDATETODAY – 1 or 0. 1 by default, membership default to start today. Otherwise a date has to be selected. DIRECTDEBITADDRESS. Address (line 1) to be used for direct debit payments.1 DIRECTDEBITCITY. City to be used in address for direct debit payments. DIRECTDEBITCOUNTY. County to be used in address for direct debit payments. DIRECTDEBITPOSTCODE. Post code to be used in address for direct debit payments. DIRECTDEBITCOUNTRY. Country to be used in address for direct debit payments. DIRECTDEBITPHONENO. Telephone number to be used in address for direct debit payments. Web.config requires this setting for DD’s: DIRECTDEBITTEAMNAME. Direct debit team name to be used in direct debit blurb for direct debit payments. DIRECTDEBITSERVICEUSERNUMBER. Service user number is displayed on the Direct Debit form as is specific to the company. DDBANKLOOKUPUSERNAME. Direct debit username for bank account details check. DDBANKLOOKUPPASSWORD. Direct debit password for bank account details check. DROPDOWNMAX. Default is 15. The maximum quantity in the item drop downs. CLEARBASKETPOPUP – 1 or 0. Popup is shown on membership page to either clear the basket or go to the basket if there is a membership already in the basket. SHOWCHAINCONTINUE. 1 or 0. On a follow-on template, display a “Continue” button to skip to the next template or basket. REDIRECTTODEFAULTFROMTIDS. If not showing the default template, redirect to it if current template in this comma separated list of TIDs. RENEWALXDAYSBEFORE. Default is 90. Number of days before the expiry of a membership that a renewal discount can be provided. RENEWALXDAYSAFTER. Default is 0. Number of days after the expiry of a membership that a renewal discount can be provided. SEATINGFORMAT - 1 or 0. Use set style formatting. Otherwise, use “divSeatingBlock” CSS. QUEUESIZE. Number of concurrent users on the website. -1 is to only record the number of concurrent users. 0 is no limit (off). USEPRICEBANDS – 1 or 0. Allows the ticket calendars to be coloured by price band. The admin section will allow for price bands to be created and modified. MEMCARDVALIDDAYS. The same membership card can’t be used on another transaction for this amount of days. Default is 100. MEMCARDALLOWREUSE. Allow the same membership number to be used on the basket page. SHOWBASKETBEFOREMEMDETS – 1 or 0. Display the basket before asking for the membership details. ALLOWDDBYCREDITCARD – 1 or 0. MEMBERSTARTAHEADDAYS – maximum number of days memberships can be started. GENDERNEUTRALTITLE – 1 or 0. Add gender neutral title on the payment page. DELIVERYOPTIONSPERITEM – NOT USED. Use DELIVERYOPTIONS set to “2” instead BASKETGIFTAID – 1 or 0. Allows GA to be selected on the basket page and adds donation & without donation buttons to the ticket pages. USEUNIQUEVOUCHERS – 1 or 0. Allows numbered vouchers to be bought and used. NOADDRESSRESOURCEIDS - Comma separated list of bookable resource IDs that if purchased hide the customer address on the payment screen. Must have no sales order or shop items in the basket. GDPRCUSTPREFS – 1 or 0. Allows customers to specific where, how & who uses their data. Customers need to have purchased the GDPR module for the back-office. MEMBERPHOTOUPLOAD – 1 or 0. Allows customers to upload membership images which are downloaded to the Merac back-office on successful payment. ALLOWBARCODEPRINTING – 1 or 0. 0 By default, allows barcodes to be printed on confirmation emails. TOTALMAXQTYFOLLOWONTIDS – List of follow on IDs that can only total the number of tickets purchased on the first (or start) template. PNVOUCHEREMAILLINK – 1 or 0. 0 by default, if set to 1 will display a “Gift Voucher” link on the confirmation email to a page that displays the purchased gift vouchers, otherwise these purchased numbered vouchers are displayed on the email. RECENTBOOKINGS. Specify how many minutes to look back to check if a successful booking has already been placed by the same customer. Default is 1 minute. BASKETSHOPCATEGORIES – 1 or 0. 0 by default, if 1 will display the shop category links & product search on the basket page to enhance navigation. SHOPRELATEDITEMS – 1 or 0. Display related shop items on the product item page. SHOPOTHERPURCHASES – 1 or 0. Display products that have been bought with the selected product. SHOPQANDA – 1 or 0. Displays shop questions and answers for the selected product. SHOPREVIEWS – 1 or 0. Display reviews written by customers on the product page. SHOPADDNOREDIRECT – 1 or 0. When set to 1 will instruct the shop item “Add to basket” button to stay on the same page and not redirect to the basket. (Currently works on product-list pages only) SPLITDONATIONGRID – 1 or 0. This will display the tickets (on the buy page only) in two grids – with and without Gift Aid donations. The Gift Aid options will appear on the basket page. INCLUDEQTYINBASKET – 1 or 0. This will reduce the number of session tickets available by including any session ticket that is currently in any basket at the time. Needed for popular fast-selling events where availability is limited. ECOMMERCEVERSION. This is the version of tracking integration used by the website and depends on the type of tracking account used by the customer. (internal/admin only USEWSEMAIL – 1 or 0. 0 by default. When set to 1 will use a web service on the shop server to send confirmation email. SHOPEMAILUSEBOOKINGID – 1 or 0. 0 by default. When set to 1 the website will ignore any shop items in the basket and will instead use the specific template id to send confirmation emails. SUPPRESSPRICEBANDERRORTEMPLATEIDS. This is a comma-separated list of template IDs that should ignore seating page check for missing price band resources. BASKETSOLDALONE – 1 or 0. 0 by default. When set to 1, there needs to be an item in the basket WITHOUT the “CannotBeSoldAlone” flag set. RENEWALMESSAGEENABLED – 1 or 0. 0 by default. HIDEDATACAPTUREONEMAILS – 1 or 0. When 1 will remove data capture fields from appearing on the relevant items on the confirmation email. This doesn’t affect the merge field. GAPLEADDONATIONINFO – 1 or 0. When 1 will display extra Gift Aid information on the “buy” ticketing page as an overlay to give customer a second chance to donate. USEAMEX – 1 or 0. When 1 will display “AMEX” card in the list of payment card on the payment page. FORCESESSIONREMOTETIDS. A list of CSVs relating to session template IDs that use back-office stored procedures for determining items for each day. HIDENUMBEREDVOUCHEREXPIRY – 1 or 0. When 1 will hide the expiry date from the numbered vouchers displayed on the confirmation email. USEADOPTIONRENEWALV2 – 1 or 0. When 1 the site will use the new adoption renewal page. USEEXTRACHECKBOX1 – 1 or 0. When 1 an extra checkbox will be displayed along with a customer message. Useful for getting users to agree to more than just the regular T&Cs, e.g. COVID terms. DEFAULTSESSIONCALENDARTOTODAY – 0 or 1. When 1 the session calendar defaults to today regardless of whether there are any sessions available. FILTEROUTDDFROMRENEWALS – 0 or 1. When 1 direct debit is filtered out of renewal options. SOLDOUTMESSAGE – text displayed when no sessions are available. If this is not set or blank then nothing is shown. FREEDELIVERYOVERTOTAL – if this value is not zero, and the basket total is great than this value, the shipping cost is set to £0 (free). SESSIONTYPETIMESLOTTEMPLATEIDS – this is blank for none, "ALL" for all templates, or comma-separated list of IDs DYNAMICTITLES – this allows for the “title” dropdown to be populated with these comma-separated values. If blank, the defaults are used. BUYAVAILABILITYCOLOURS – Comma-separated list of colours for calendar availability on the buyavail page BUYAVAILABILITYPERCENTAGES – Comma-separated list of percentage splits for calendar availability on the buyavail page BUYAVAILABILITYKEYTEXT – Comma separated values of key titles for available tickets per day on the buyavail page DELAYFAILEDTRANSRETRYMINS – The number of mins before the “try-again” link is activated when a card payment fails. WHITELISTEDIPS – Comma separated list of whitelisted IPs. Used for administration of discount vouchers so web.config file does not need to be changed. USELIVECARDS – 0 or 1. Enables the Live Card functionality. ACCINVTEMPLATEIDS – Comma-separated list of template IDs that are eligible for Account Invoicing UNIQUETICKETEMAILFORMAT – 0 is default view with barcode on the right-hand side of the details. 1 moves the barcode to the left-hand side.
description:
https://axk3btg.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/K3ExeterDev/Shared%20Documents/General/Website%20Config%20Options.docx?d=we33ab0bc65ee415e9cc548520eee294d&csf=1&web=1&e=fdV4cK 

Website Config Options  

  

These are used to send booking & order confirmation emails.  

• EMAILFROMADD  

• EMAILSERVER  

• EMAILSERVERUID  

• EMAILSERVERPWD  

• EMAILSERVERPORT  

• EMAILSERVERSSL  

• EMAILSERVERTIMEOUT  

  

SECOPTSTR - This is to set the payment gateway to LIVE or TEST mode Values: ‘TEST’, ‘LIVE’, or for PayPoint (SecPay): Test Positive = test_status=true,dups=false,repeat=true Test Negative = test_status=false,dups=false,repeat=true Live = test_status=live,repeat=true  

  

Address lookups.  

• CAPSCANUID  

• CAPSCANPWD  

  

CUSTSERVEMAIL – Email address used for shop questions.  

CUSTSERVTEL – Phone number used for shop help  

COMPANYNAME – Name of website.  

DEFAULTTEMPLATE – Goes to this if no TID is specified.  

EMAILCCBKGCONF. 0 – Don’t send CC booking email, 1 send it.  

EMAILCCBKGCONFTOADDR – CC booking email address.  

EMAILBCCBKGCONF. 0 – Don’t send BCC booking email, 1 send it.  

EMAILBCCBKGCONFTOADDR – BCC booking email address.  

EMAILREPLYTOADDR – “Reply To” address used if customer replies to booking confirmation emails. 

PAYMENTPROVIDER – Payment Provider name, e.g. PayPoint, SagePayDirect, WorldPay etc. 

PAYPALEMAILADDRESS – PayPal email address used for PayPal integration. These are specific options for PayPal integration:  

• PAYPALRETURNURL • PAYPALCANCELURL 

  

COMPANYHOMEPAGE – URL of “Back to Home” link used on the confirmation page. 

COMPANYTERMSPAGE – T’s & C’s URL to link to from the payment page. 

REGISTRATION – Values are ‘none’, ’optional’ or ‘required’ 

USEVOUCHERS – Show the voucher box on the basket page. 

  

These are specific options the party page:  

• PARTYFOOD – Comma separated template ID’s that require party food options.  

• PARTYMEMBERNOS – Comma separated template ID’s that require party membership numbers.  

• LIMITPARTYDROPDOWNS – Set max quantity for party dropdowns.  

• PARTYNOTICEPERIOD – Number of days from today’s date before party is available 

  

  

UNAVAILABILITYCOLOURS - Format: , []  

AVAILABILITYCOLOURS – Format: , []  

SELECTEDCOLOURS – Format: , []  

HIDEUNSELECTEDMONTH – On Buy, BuyAvail & Sessions pages, only show currently selected month days on calendar.  

GIFTAIDEXTRA – Paragraph appears under GA coins  

GIFTAIDDEFAULTOFF – GA is unselected unless items in basket and GA has been chosen already. 

GIFTAIDBLURBABOVE – Put GA section above the ticket section. Buy/Sessions/Memberships only (ATM). VIRTUALFOLDER – Used by SagePay to return to website folder.  

APPLY3DSECURE – Allow for 3D Secure for card details after payment details submitted. 

BACKOFFICEPASSWORD – Password used by customer to access website back-office for updates and other website admin functions.  

EMAILTEMPLATE – Name of template file used for booking emails (depreciated, only used by WH). 

CONTINUESHOPPING – URL to go to when the “Continue Shopping” button is clicked.  

SHOPCHECKSTOCK – Allows sales of shop items to be limited by stock levels.  

SHOPSTOCKRINGFENCE – Quantity to remove from stock level to further limit sales.  

DELIVERYOPTIONS – Values 0 or 1. Show delivery area (UK, EU, ROW) + shipping prices in basket. A value of “2” - Allows different postage option based on what is in the basket. Postage services & bands need to be setup in advance.  

DELIVERYMETHOD – Calculate shipping price by “weight” (per area “UK/EU/ROW”) or “price” or “weight only”.  

SITETAGLINE – Paragraph shown on the shop category page 

  

  

COMPLETEORDERS – Allow the “complete orders” page to be accessed from the website back-office.

UPDATETRANSLATIONS – Allow additional language translations to be accessed from the website back-office.  

UPDATEEMAILTEMPLATES –Allow confirmation email templates to be updated from the website back-office.  

ALLOWDIFFSESSIONDATE – Allow the session date to be different on follow-on templates.  

AUTOCONTINUENODATA – If disallowing different dates, auto continue if selected date is not available when following on to next template.  

SHOWTOTALAVAILABLE – Show session total next to each time-slot. On by default.  

SESSIONAVAILABILTYMAX – If available quantity is over this value, show “available” instead of quantity. 

EMAILGIFTAIDTHANKS – Paragraph to add to the booking confirmation email if the tag in in the template and the booking has been Gift Aided.  

SESSIONNOTICEPERIOD – Number of days from today’s date before sessions are available.

SESSIONNOTICEPERIODHOURS – Number of days from current time before session time-slots are available.  

MEMBEREMAIL – Email address to send to for copies of purchased memberships.  

ADOPTIONEMAIL – Email address to send to for copies of purchased adoptions.  

RETAILEMAIL – Email address to send to for copies of purchased adoptions.  

TIMESLOTSESSIONDESC – 0/1 Show session description on session time-slot  

BOOKINGSOURCE – 0/1 Store selected booking source for booking.  

BOOKINGSOURCEREQUIRED – Set the booking source on payment page to be mandatory.

SAMEDAYCUTOFFTIME- Time after which no further bookings can be placed for today.

TELEPHONEREQUIRED – Set telephone to be mandatory on the payment page.  

COUNTYREQUIRED – Set county to be mandatory on the payment page.  

DEBUGLOG – Log additional details about the booking process.  

DISABLEGIFTAIDPOPUP – Buy/Memberships/Renewal skips past the GA popup.  

AllOWGIFTING – Values ‘address’,’name & email’, ‘addressoptional’. Allow booking to be gifted to a different address or name & email. Shows different messages on the confirmation page.

FIXEDVALIDITYPERIODS – 0/1 Used by RHS on Buy page for Jan – Mar, Apr – Oct buying periods. These are setup in table “TemplatePeriod”.  

USEMEMBERSHIPS – Allows membership pages to be used on the website.  

USEDONATIONS – Shows a checkbox to add donation (the gift aid price) regardless of whether the booking is Gift Aided 

  

  

DONATEBYDEFAULT – If using the donations tick-box, tick it by default.  

SHOWONEGAPRICE – 1 or 0. This will show one price in the grid that changes based on whether the booking is Gift Aided.  

ADOPTIONSHOWEMAIL – Email address textbox is displayed on the membership details screen.

ADOPTIONSHOWPHONE – Telephone textbox is displayed on the membership details screen.

ADOPTIONSHOWADDRESS – Address textboxes are displayed on the membership details screen.

ADOPTIONSHOWDOB – Date of birth textboxes are displayed on the membership details screen.

ADOPTIONDONATIONS – Allow donations to be added for adoptions. “1” By Default  

FORCEDATEPICK – Hides the sales grid until a booking date is selected.  

WEBSERVICEURL – The URL for the webservice installed on the customer’s server.  

WEBSERVICEUSERNAME – The login name for the webservice.  

WEBSERVICEPASSWORD – The password for the webservice.  

MEMBERTERMS – The URL to membership T’s & C’s. Will display a tick box on the membership webpage that requires ticking.  

PRODUCTSPERPAGE – The number of products to show per page. Default is 4.  

VATNUMBER – The business VAT number.  

VATPERCENTAGE – The current VAT percentage. Default is 20.  

EMAILEMBEDDED – Default is 0. Email barcodes & logos are sent in the email content instead as references to images.  

PROMOEMAILS – Default is 1. Shows the “Do you want to receive promotional emails” check box on payment page.  

DONATIONRESOURCE – The resource ID of the donation resource record.  

DONATIONROUNDUP – Default is 0. Will show on the basket page an option to round up to the nearest £10. So if the basket total is £17, this option will round the price to £20 with a £3 donation.  

HASRETAIL - Default is 0. Allow the shop items to be displayed.  

MEMBERTEMPNO - Default is 1. Will show the temporary membership number on the confirmation email.  

ALLOWDELIVERYADDRESS - Default is 0. This will display a checkbox on the payment page that allows a delivery address to be entered. ALLOWGIFTING option must be blank 

  

  

ADMINORDEREMAIL - Email address to send copy of order confirmation email to. Admin order email is sent to this address.  

ADMINADOPTIONEMAIL – Email address to send admin adoption email to.  

ADMINMEMBEREMAIL – Email address to send admin membership email to.  

ADMINSALESORDEREMAIL – Email address to send sales order email to.  

ADMINRETAILEMAIL – Email address to send order email to.  

SECONDDBRESIDS – Second database list of resource IDs. (Used by Paignton Zoo to record booking at Living Coasts)  

SECONDDBURL –Second database web service URL.  

USEDONATIONCHOICE- Show a Yes/No donation option on buy pages.  

PARTYARRIVALHOUR – Default is 9. Shown on party webpage. If set to -1, arrival time is hidden from the party page and arrival defaulted to 9am.  

LISTTEMPLATEIDS – The templates shown on the welcome page. Can be "ALL" or comma separated list of IDs.  

ADOPTIONFOLLOWONID – The template to show after an adoption has been selected. SUPPRESSPAYERSELECTOR – 1 or 0. Hide member payer dropdown box.  

GADONATIONCOMBO – 1 or 0. Show “Donation” checkbox for Gift Aid.  

WEBREPORTS – 1 or 0. Display website reports button in the admin section.  

SHOWSESSIONTITLE – 1 or 0. Show session page template name as the page title.  

SESSIONAUTOSCROLL – 1 or 0. 1 by default. Set the session page to automatically scroll when selecting a time slot.  

SESSIONHIDEENDTIME – 1 or 0. Only show start time.  

CONFIRMATIONBASKET – 1 or 0. Display the basket on the confirmation page after a successful payment.  

DONATIONDELETEONLY- 1 or 0. Does not show donation section if donation has been made. WELCOMESEASONTID – Set welcome button to go to a specific template ID.  

RENEWALSAMESCHEME – 1 or 0. Disable all schemes except membership scheme currently enrolled on. CHECKACCESSLOOKUP – 1 or 0. Allow check access lookup in admin section 

  

  

CHECKACCESSPASSWORD – Password for access to admin section for check access page. GOOGLEANALYTICSACCCODE – GA account code for confirmation page tracking.  

USEALTGAID – If webpage parameter “AltGA=true” is present, this alternative Google Analytics code is used instead. “<%=m_strGAAccID %>” needs to also be present in the GA script on the MainPage.master webpage.  

  

SKIPBASKETPAGE – 1 or 0. After buy page, redirect to login or payment page. MEMBERSHOWBASKETPAGE – 1 or 0. Redirect to the basket page after membership details have been entered.  

FOLLOWONREDIRECT – 1 or 0. Redirect to starting template no items are in the basket and the template is part of the chain.  

SHOWINHOUSEPRICE – 1 or 0. Show gate or in-house price on the ticket grid.  

HIDETITLEOFNAME – 1 or 0. Hide title dropdown on payment page.  

DISALLOWDIFFERENTDATES – 1 or 0. Show message on session page if a different date is selected for something already in the basket.  

ENFORCESTARTTEMPLATE – 1 or 0. Checks if item in basket and if not, do not add items to be added to basket.  

LIMITQTYTOSTARTTEMPLATE – 1 or 0. Follow-on template items have a maximum quantity is what was selected on start template.  

MEMBERSHIPSTARTDATE – 1 or 0. Show membership start date on initial membership page. MEMBERSHIPHIDEDETAILS – 1 or 0. V1 membership, hide membership detail validation. MEMBERDETAILSV2 – 1 or 0. Use version 2 (hobbledown style) for membership entry. MEMBERSHIPSTARTDATETODAY – 1 or 0. 1 by default, membership default to start today. Otherwise a date has to be selected.  

DIRECTDEBITADDRESS. Address (line 1) to be used for direct debit payments.1  

DIRECTDEBITCITY. City to be used in address for direct debit payments.  

DIRECTDEBITCOUNTY. County to be used in address for direct debit payments.  

DIRECTDEBITPOSTCODE. Post code to be used in address for direct debit payments. 

DIRECTDEBITCOUNTRY. Country to be used in address for direct debit payments.  

DIRECTDEBITPHONENO. Telephone number to be used in address for direct debit payments.  

  

 Web.config requires this setting for DD’s:  

  

DIRECTDEBITTEAMNAME. Direct debit team name to be used in direct debit blurb for direct debit payments.  

DIRECTDEBITSERVICEUSERNUMBER. Service user number is displayed on the Direct Debit form as is specific to the company.  

DDBANKLOOKUPUSERNAME. Direct debit username for bank account details check. DDBANKLOOKUPPASSWORD. Direct debit password for bank account details check.  

DROPDOWNMAX. Default is 15. The maximum quantity in the item drop downs.  

CLEARBASKETPOPUP – 1 or 0. Popup is shown on membership page to either clear the basket or go to the basket if there is a membership already in the basket.  

SHOWCHAINCONTINUE. 1 or 0. On a follow-on template, display a “Continue” button to skip to the next template or basket.  

REDIRECTTODEFAULTFROMTIDS. If not showing the default template, redirect to it if current template in this comma separated list of TIDs.  

RENEWALXDAYSBEFORE. Default is 90. Number of days before the expiry of a membership that a renewal discount can be provided.  

RENEWALXDAYSAFTER. Default is 0. Number of days after the expiry of a membership that a renewal discount can be provided.  

SEATINGFORMAT - 1 or 0. Use set style formatting. Otherwise, use “divSeatingBlock” CSS.  

QUEUESIZE. Number of concurrent users on the website. -1 is to only record the number of concurrent users. 0 is no limit (off).  

USEPRICEBANDS – 1 or 0. Allows the ticket calendars to be coloured by price band. The admin section will allow for price bands to be created and modified.  

MEMCARDVALIDDAYS. The same membership card can’t be used on another transaction for this amount of days. Default is 100.  

MEMCARDALLOWREUSE. Allow the same membership number to be used on the basket page. SHOWBASKETBEFOREMEMDETS – 1 or 0. Display the basket before asking for the membership details. ALLOWDDBYCREDITCARD – 1 or 0.  

MEMBERSTARTAHEADDAYS – maximum number of days memberships can be started.  

GENDERNEUTRALTITLE – 1 or 0. Add gender neutral title on the payment page.  

DELIVERYOPTIONSPERITEM – NOT USED. Use DELIVERYOPTIONS set to “2” instead 

  

  

BASKETGIFTAID – 1 or 0. Allows GA to be selected on the basket page and adds donation & without donation buttons to the ticket pages.  

USEUNIQUEVOUCHERS – 1 or 0. Allows numbered vouchers to be bought and used.

NOADDRESSRESOURCEIDS - Comma separated list of bookable resource IDs that if purchased hide the customer address on the payment screen. Must have no sales order or shop items in the basket. GDPRCUSTPREFS – 1 or 0. Allows customers to specific where, how & who uses their data. Customers need to have purchased the GDPR module for the back-office.  

MEMBERPHOTOUPLOAD – 1 or 0. Allows customers to upload membership images which are downloaded to the Merac back-office on successful payment.  

ALLOWBARCODEPRINTING – 1 or 0. 0 By default, allows barcodes to be printed on confirmation emails. TOTALMAXQTYFOLLOWONTIDS – List of follow on IDs that can only total the number of tickets purchased on the first (or start) template.  

PNVOUCHEREMAILLINK – 1 or 0. 0 by default, if set to 1 will display a “Gift Voucher” link on the confirmation email to a page that displays the purchased gift vouchers, otherwise these purchased numbered vouchers are displayed on the email.  

RECENTBOOKINGS. Specify how many minutes to look back to check if a successful booking has already been placed by the same customer. Default is 1 minute.  

BASKETSHOPCATEGORIES – 1 or 0. 0 by default, if 1 will display the shop category links & product search on the basket page to enhance navigation.  

SHOPRELATEDITEMS – 1 or 0. Display related shop items on the product item page. SHOPOTHERPURCHASES – 1 or 0. Display products that have been bought with the selected product. SHOPQANDA – 1 or 0. Displays shop questions and answers for the selected product.  

SHOPREVIEWS – 1 or 0. Display reviews written by customers on the product page. SHOPADDNOREDIRECT – 1 or 0. When set to 1 will instruct the shop item “Add to basket” button to stay on the same page and not redirect to the basket. (Currently works on product-list pages only) SPLITDONATIONGRID – 1 or 0. This will display the tickets (on the buy page only) in two grids – with and without Gift Aid donations. The Gift Aid options will appear on the basket page.  

INCLUDEQTYINBASKET – 1 or 0. This will reduce the number of session tickets available by including any session ticket that is currently in any basket at the time. Needed for popular fast-selling events where availability is limited.  

ECOMMERCEVERSION. This is the version of tracking integration used by the website and depends on the type of tracking account used by the customer. (internal/admin only 

  

USEWSEMAIL – 1 or 0. 0 by default. When set to 1 will use a web service on the shop server to send confirmation email.  

SHOPEMAILUSEBOOKINGID – 1 or 0. 0 by default. When set to 1 the website will ignore any shop items in the basket and will instead use the specific template id to send confirmation emails. SUPPRESSPRICEBANDERRORTEMPLATEIDS. This is a comma-separated list of template IDs that should ignore seating page check for missing price band resources.  

BASKETSOLDALONE – 1 or 0. 0 by default. When set to 1, there needs to be an item in the basket WITHOUT the “CannotBeSoldAlone” flag set. 

  

RENEWALMESSAGEENABLED – 1 or 0. 0 by default. 

  

HIDEDATACAPTUREONEMAILS – 1 or 0. When 1 will remove data capture fields from appearing on the relevant items on the confirmation email.  This doesn’t affect the <MERGE.DATACAPTURE/> merge field. 

  

GAPLEADDONATIONINFO – 1 or 0. When 1 will display extra Gift Aid information on the “buy” ticketing page as an overlay to give customer a second chance to donate. 

  

USEAMEX – 1 or 0. When 1 will display “AMEX” card in the list of payment card on the payment page. 

  

FORCESESSIONREMOTETIDS.  A list of CSVs relating to session template IDs that use back-office stored procedures for determining items for each day. 

  

HIDENUMBEREDVOUCHEREXPIRY – 1 or 0. When 1 will hide the expiry date from the numbered vouchers displayed on the confirmation email. 

  

USEADOPTIONRENEWALV2 – 1 or 0. When 1 the site will use the new adoption renewal page. 

  

USEEXTRACHECKBOX1 – 1 or 0. When 1 an extra checkbox will be displayed along with a customer message. Useful for getting users to agree to more than just the regular T&Cs, e.g. COVID terms. 

  

DEFAULTSESSIONCALENDARTOTODAY – 0 or 1. When 1 the session calendar defaults to today regardless of whether there are any sessions available. 

  

FILTEROUTDDFROMRENEWALS – 0 or 1. When 1 direct debit is filtered out of renewal options. 

  

SOLDOUTMESSAGE – text displayed when no sessions are available. If this is not set or blank then nothing is shown. 

  

FREEDELIVERYOVERTOTAL – if this value is not zero, and the basket total is great than this value, the shipping cost is set to £0 (free). 

  

SESSIONTYPETIMESLOTTEMPLATEIDS – this is blank for none, "ALL" for all templates, or comma-separated list of IDs 

  

DYNAMICTITLES – this allows for the “title” dropdown to be populated with these comma-separated values.  If blank, the defaults are used. 

  

BUYAVAILABILITYCOLOURS – Comma-separated list of colours for calendar availability on the buyavail page 

  

BUYAVAILABILITYPERCENTAGES – Comma-separated list of percentage splits for calendar availability on the buyavail page 

  

BUYAVAILABILITYKEYTEXT – Comma separated values of key titles for available tickets per day on the buyavail page 

  

DELAYFAILEDTRANSRETRYMINS – The number of mins before the “try-again” link is activated when a card payment fails. 

  

WHITELISTEDIPS – Comma separated list of whitelisted IPs.  Used for administration of discount vouchers so web.config file does not need to be changed. 

  

USELIVECARDS – 0 or 1. Enables the Live Card functionality. 

  

ACCINVTEMPLATEIDS – Comma-separated list of template IDs that are eligible for Account Invoicing 

  

UNIQUETICKETEMAILFORMAT – 0 is default view with barcode on the right-hand side of the details. 1 moves the barcode to the left-hand side.

title: 'No valid renewals available' When Trying to Renew Adoption
text: Error When trying to renew an adoption through the membership/adoption renewal page (https://[web server].myonlinebooking.co.uk/[site name]/renewals.aspx), and you receive the below error message for a valid expired/expiring adoption. Resolution Make sure the adoption Membership Type has a £0 Membership Fee PLU set.
description:
Error


When trying to renew an adoption through the membership/adoption renewal page (https://[web server].myonlinebooking.co.uk/[site name]/renewals.aspx), and you receive the below error message for a valid expired/expiring adoption.



Resolution


Make sure the adoption Membership Type has a £0 Membership Fee PLU set.

title: Updating Order Postage
text: It is possible to update the online order postage via the MStore database There is a table called Order Postage. You can have multiple different weights set up, and each weight will have a specific price associated per UK, Europe and Rest of World. (Example from Hever Castle) You can simply update the required postage field: begin transaction UPdate OrderPostage Set odpRestofWorld = '25.00' --commit Once done, you then need to log into the website admin menu and update the templates and images and data. You should see OrderPostage in the update:
description:
It is possible to update the online order postage via the MStore database


There is a table called Order Postage. 


You can have multiple different weights set up, and each weight will have a specific price associated per UK, Europe and Rest of World. 


(Example from Hever Castle)


You can simply update the required postage field:


begin transaction

UPdate OrderPostage 

Set odpRestofWorld = '25.00'

--commit


Once done, you then need to log into the website admin menu and update the templates and images and data. 



You should see OrderPostage in the update:

title: Error When Attempting To Update Website Templates
text: When you click on Update Templates in the website login page, and you receive an error, which refers to "Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation", this is usually because our web server cannot contact the customers MStore server's MeracOnlineInterface API. The same issue is caused with "no sessions can be found", and clicking "Pay Now" returns straight to Payment failed. This will need to be passed to second line support to investigate, making sure the cusWebserviceURL on the web server the website is situated on, is correct, and the customer has port forwarding is correctly set for port 22221. If a customer reports this on a weekend, this will have to be chargeable request at emergency in extended hours rate (code P0000589). You can explain this is due to we would need to involve a website and web server infrastructure specialist to investigate, update if applicable and report back further information. This can be because the customers public IP address may have changed, which we need to update out web server to be aware of this change. Harry Willatts or Richard Heathman need to be informed to investigate and resolve this issue.
description:
When you click on Update Templates in the website login page, and you receive an error, which refers to "Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation", this is usually because our web server cannot contact the customers MStore server's MeracOnlineInterface API. The same issue is caused with "no sessions can be found", and clicking "Pay Now" returns straight to Payment failed.


This will need to be passed to second line support to investigate, making sure the cusWebserviceURL on the web server the website is situated on, is correct, and the customer has port forwarding is correctly set for port 22221.



If a customer reports this on a weekend, this will have to be chargeable request at emergency in extended hours rate (code P0000589). You can explain this is due to we would need to involve a website and web server infrastructure specialist to investigate, update if applicable and report back further information.


This can be because the customers public IP address may have changed, which we need to update out web server to be aware of this change. Harry Willatts or Richard Heathman need to be informed to investigate and resolve this issue.

title: Booking Confirmation Email Templates Not Updating
text: When making changes to booking confirmation email templates, and you leave and re-enter the page, and your changes have not been saved, this is likely due to duplicate booking confirmation email templates in the EmailTemplates table in the customers website database. To fix this, you will need to make sure the HTML text for the email templates that reference the same emtTemplateID is the same, to then remove the surplus records. SQL below to help: SELECT * FROM EmailTemplate --WHERE emtDesc LIKE '%%' ORDER BY emtTemplateID SELECT * INTO BAKEmailTemplate[DATE] FROM EmailTemplate BEGIN TRANSACTION DELETE FROM EmailTemplate WHERE emtID IN (,,,) --COMMIT Once you have removed the duplicates, your changes made online should then save as expected.
description:
When making changes to booking confirmation email templates, and you leave and re-enter the page, and your changes have not been saved, this is likely due to duplicate booking confirmation email templates in the EmailTemplates table in the customers website database.


To fix this, you will need to make sure the HTML text for the email templates that reference the same emtTemplateID is the same, to then remove the surplus records. SQL below to help:


SELECT * FROM EmailTemplate
--WHERE emtDesc LIKE '%%'
ORDER BY emtTemplateID

SELECT * INTO BAKEmailTemplate[DATE] FROM EmailTemplate

BEGIN TRANSACTION 
DELETE FROM EmailTemplate
WHERE emtID IN (,,,)
--COMMIT


Once you have removed the duplicates, your changes made online should then save as expected.

title: QR Codes Not Appearing On Booking Confirmation Emails
text: To troubleshoot QR codes not showing on booking confirmation emails, you want to first make sure the web config option has been applied and ticked for the customer wanting to use this: ALLOWBARCODEPRINTING You then will want to check the merge field is set on the booking confirmation email templates in question. If, upon testing re-sending a live booking confirmation email, and the QR code still does not show, this could be due to the website code being older than when the QR code functionality had been implemented. Web development has mentioned that the QR code functionality had been implemented around June 2021. So websites with code older than this will not work. To get an idea of the date the customers' website has been last updated, second line support will need to go into their bin folder in the website folder on the web server, and check their latest modified files. If this date is before June 2021, they are likely on an older version, that won't be able to use this functionality. If this is the case, the customer will need to speak to their account manager to get a quote for a website update.
description:
To troubleshoot QR codes not showing on booking confirmation emails, you want to first make sure the web config option has been applied and ticked for the customer wanting to use this: ALLOWBARCODEPRINTING 



You then will want to check the <MERGE.QRBARCODEIMG/> merge field is set on the booking confirmation email templates in question.


If, upon testing re-sending a live booking confirmation email, and the QR code still does not show, this could be due to the website code being older than when the QR code functionality had been implemented.


Web development has mentioned that the QR code functionality had been implemented around June 2021. So websites with code older than this will not work.


To get an idea of the date the customers' website has been last updated, second line support will need to go into their bin folder in the website folder on the web server, and check their latest modified files. If this date is before June 2021, they are likely on an older version, that won't be able to use this functionality.



If this is the case, the customer will need to speak to their account manager to get a quote for a website update.

title: Enabling barcodes on email confirmations
text: To enable barcodes on email confirmations there are a few steps you need to follow. 1. Within the web config you need to add: ALLOWBARCODEPRINTING 2. In the web templates that require the barcode, you will need to add merge field: (Make a copy of the template as a backup before making changes) Save the template once the merge field is added. 3. Update templates from the admin menu ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ To check this has worked. Add something to the basket for testing: Select the correct template within 'Update Email Templates' Click Preview:
description:
To enable barcodes on email confirmations there are a few steps you need to follow. 


1. Within the web config you need to add: ALLOWBARCODEPRINTING



2. In the web templates that require the barcode, you will need to add merge field: <merge.barcodeimg />


(Make a copy of the template as a backup before making changes)


<td align="center"><merge.barcodeimg /></td>



Save the template once the merge field is added. 



3. Update templates from the admin menu



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


To check this has worked. 


Add something to the basket for testing:



Select the correct template within 'Update Email Templates'



Click Preview:

title: Days For Sessions Showing Available, When There Isn't Any Availability On That Day
text: If you have a customer reporting that there are days showing available on the calendar online, but there are no sessions showing available, run the below SQL to resolve this issue. This will recalculate the SeatAvailability table for each session, that is used online. declare @tSes table (RecNo int) declare @sesRecNo int insert @tSes select shdRecNo from SessionHdr where datediff(day,getdate(),shdDateTime) >= 0 WHILE EXISTS(SELECT * FROM @tSes) BEGIN select top 1 @sesRecNo = RecNo from @tSes exec MC_SeatAvailability @Branch = 1, @SesRecNo = @sesRecNo delete @tSes where recno = @sesRecNo END GO
description:
If you have a customer reporting that there are days showing available on the calendar online, but there are no sessions showing available, run the below SQL to resolve this issue. This will recalculate the SeatAvailability table for each session, that is used online.


declare @tSes table (RecNo int)  
declare @sesRecNo int
insert @tSes select shdRecNo from SessionHdr where datediff(day,getdate(),shdDateTime) >= 0 

WHILE EXISTS(SELECT * FROM @tSes)
BEGIN  
  select top 1 @sesRecNo = RecNo from @tSes
  exec MC_SeatAvailability @Branch = 1, @SesRecNo = @sesRecNo
  delete @tSes where recno = @sesRecNo
END
GO

title: Latest WEB_SessionAvailability_ALT & WEB_SessionCalendar_ALT Stored Procedures

description: Here are the latest WEB_SessionAvailability_ALT & WEB_SessionCalendar_ALT stored procedures, that will be kept up-to-date with any changes to the main stored procedure by Harry, so anyone can retrieve them.

title: Remove 'This Membership Renewal Qualifies For A Discount' Text On Online Membership Renewal Page
text: If there are sites that do not offer discounts when renewing within or after a certain period of time, but their customers see this message, and expect that they qualify for a discount. They will request to remove this text on the website. The simplest way to do this is to add the below web config options into their config, and set both options to 0. RENEWALXDAYSBEFORE - Default is 90. Number of days before the expiry of a membership that a renewal discount can be provided. RENEWALXDAYSAFTER - Default is 0. Number of days after the expiry of a membership that a renewal discount can be provided. When you test renewing again, this text will no longer show. If a customer is asking about this, you can send this Knowledge Base article to them: Remove 'This Membership Renewal Qualifies For A Discount' Text On Online Membership Renewal Page.
description:
If there are sites that do not offer discounts when renewing within or after a certain period of time, but their customers see this message, and expect that they qualify for a discount. They will request to remove this text on the website.


The simplest way to do this is to add the below web config options into their config, and set both options to 0. 


RENEWALXDAYSBEFORE - Default is 90. Number of days before the expiry of a membership that a renewal discount can be provided.  

RENEWALXDAYSAFTER - Default is 0. Number of days after the expiry of a membership that a renewal discount can be provided.  


When you test renewing again, this text will no longer show.


If a customer is asking about this, you can send this Knowledge Base article to them: Remove 'This Membership Renewal Qualifies For A Discount' Text On Online Membership Renewal Page.

description: Harry & Richard can access this server via the K3 development RDP environment, using IP: 194.164.18.105:3389. This has the same username and password as the web servers.

title: No Results Were Returned When Running Online Voucher Usage Report
text: If a customer is running the Voucher Usage report in their online Back Office portal, then their REP_VoucherUsage stored procedure on their website database needs to be updated to have the below variables to be varchar(30). @strFromDate varchar(20), @strToDate varchar(20) This is because the website sends the dates in this format, which is longer than 20 characters. exec REP_VoucherUsage @strVoucherCode='night10',@strFromDate='1/November/2024',@strToDate='9/November/2024 23:59:59' This is the full stored procedure below. USE [wwwDatabaseName] GO /****** Object: StoredProcedure [dbo].[REP_VoucherUsage] Script Date: 23/11/2024 13:10:41 ******/ SET ANSI_NULLS ON GO SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON GO ALTER PROCEDURE [dbo].[REP_VoucherUsage] -- Add the parameters for the stored procedure here @strVoucherCode varchar(20), @strFromDate varchar(30), @strToDate varchar(30) AS BEGIN -- SET NOCOUNT ON added to prevent extra result sets from -- interfering with SELECT statements. SET NOCOUNT ON; -- Insert statements for procedure here SELECT LocalBKGDet._BookingRef AS [Booking Ref], LocalBKGHdr.BKGComplete As [Complete], LocalBKGHdr.BKGEmailSent as [Emailed], LocalBKGHdr.BKGPaid As [Paid], LocalBKGHdr.BKGRecStatus as [Status], CONVERT(varchar(5), LocalSB.SBQty) + ' x ' + LocalSB.SBItemDesc AS [Desc], (SELECT PriceLookups.pluFootfall FROM BKGResources INNER JOIN BarCodes ON BKGResources.bkrCode = BarCodes.bcdCode INNER JOIN PriceLookups ON BarCodes.bcdPLURecNo = PriceLookups.pluRecNo WHERE (BKGResources.bkrResNo = LocalSB.SBPID)) * LocalSB.SBQty AS Footfall, InternetVouchers.ivoVoucherCode AS [Voucher Code], InternetVouchers.ivoName AS [Voucher Promo], LocalSB.SBTotalAmount As Revenue FROM LocalBKGHdr INNER JOIN InternetVouchers ON LocalBKGHdr.BKGVoucherID = InternetVouchers.ivoID INNER JOIN LocalBKGDet ON LocalBKGHdr.BKGID = LocalBKGDet.BKGID INNER JOIN LocalSB ON LocalBKGDet.DetID = LocalSB.SBBkgID WHERE (LocalSB.SBShopItem = 0 AND LocalBKGHdr.BKGRecStatus = 'B') AND (InternetVouchers.ivoVoucherCode LIKE @strVoucherCode) and BKGInitDate between convert(datetime,@strfromdate) and CONVERT(datetime,@strtodate) END
description:
If a customer is running the Voucher Usage report in their online Back Office portal, then their REP_VoucherUsage stored procedure on their website database needs to be updated to have the below variables to be varchar(30).



@strFromDate varchar(20),
@strToDate varchar(20)

This is because the website sends the dates in this format, which is longer than 20 characters.

exec REP_VoucherUsage @strVoucherCode='night10',@strFromDate='1/November/2024',@strToDate='9/November/2024 23:59:59'


This is the full stored procedure below.

USE [wwwDatabaseName]
GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[REP_VoucherUsage]    Script Date: 23/11/2024 13:10:41 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO

  ALTER PROCEDURE [dbo].[REP_VoucherUsage]
    -- Add the parameters for the stored procedure here
    @strVoucherCode varchar(20),
    @strFromDate varchar(30),
    @strToDate varchar(30)
  AS
  BEGIN
    -- SET NOCOUNT ON added to prevent extra result sets from
    -- interfering with SELECT statements.
    SET NOCOUNT ON;

    -- Insert statements for procedure here
  SELECT        LocalBKGDet._BookingRef AS [Booking Ref], LocalBKGHdr.BKGComplete As [Complete], LocalBKGHdr.BKGEmailSent as [Emailed], LocalBKGHdr.BKGPaid As [Paid], LocalBKGHdr.BKGRecStatus as [Status], 
               CONVERT(varchar(5), LocalSB.SBQty) + ' x ' + LocalSB.SBItemDesc AS [Desc],
                 (SELECT        PriceLookups.pluFootfall
                   FROM            BKGResources INNER JOIN
                               BarCodes ON BKGResources.bkrCode = BarCodes.bcdCode INNER JOIN
                               PriceLookups ON BarCodes.bcdPLURecNo = PriceLookups.pluRecNo
                   WHERE        (BKGResources.bkrResNo = LocalSB.SBPID)) * LocalSB.SBQty AS Footfall, InternetVouchers.ivoVoucherCode AS [Voucher Code], 
               InternetVouchers.ivoName AS [Voucher Promo], LocalSB.SBTotalAmount As Revenue
  FROM            LocalBKGHdr INNER JOIN
               InternetVouchers ON LocalBKGHdr.BKGVoucherID = InternetVouchers.ivoID INNER JOIN
               LocalBKGDet ON LocalBKGHdr.BKGID = LocalBKGDet.BKGID INNER JOIN
               LocalSB ON LocalBKGDet.DetID = LocalSB.SBBkgID
  WHERE        (LocalSB.SBShopItem = 0 AND LocalBKGHdr.BKGRecStatus = 'B')
  
     AND (InternetVouchers.ivoVoucherCode LIKE @strVoucherCode) and BKGInitDate between convert(datetime,@strfromdate) and CONVERT(datetime,@strtodate)
  END

title: Change Adoption Delivery Options Text
text: If a customer requests to change the Adoption Delivery Options text, this can be done in the customers website database. Change the text in the psName field within the PostageService table. Ticket example of this is https://k3support.freshdesk.com/a/tickets/65988.
description:
If a customer requests to change the Adoption Delivery Options text, this can be done in the customers website database.



Change the text in the psName field within the PostageService table. Ticket example of this is https://k3support.freshdesk.com/a/tickets/65988.
